alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:44PM EST until December 18 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Delaware... Brandywine Creek At Wilmington affecting New Castle County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Brandywine Creek at Wilmington. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, Minor flooding begins along the creek in the Brandywine State Park. At 16.5 feet, North Park Drive, west of North Market Street, in Brandywine State Park is subject to flooding and closures. At 17.0 feet, Some flooding begins in the historic Breck`s Mill area in Montchanin. At 18.0 feet, Ramsey Road is subject to closures between Del. 92 and Beaver Dam Road as the Brandywine backs up into Ransey Run. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM EST Monday was 17.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest soon and fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 12.5 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.9 feet on 02/25/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Brandywine Creek Wilmington 16.5 17.1 Mon 8 pm 13.5 12.8 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM EST.
